name: Days Inn Sedona

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Kobi and Linda and staff are amazing. Great people, clean, great location and great value. It doesnt get any better then this!
reviews.title: Loved It!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We had a very good experience with this Days Inn hotel. Definitively a good deal. Sedona can be pretty expensive. The front desk lady was very helpful with information about were to go and what to do. We went to lunch at a 4 star hotel. Gallery at Oak Creek. The food was not interesting and extremely expensive for the very limited menu. After looking at the hotel we were glad we did not waist our money. Our pool at the Days Inn was nicer and larger but their setting was nicer and in down town. Stay away from this terrible 4 star restaurant. Definitively take both of the trolleys. We also took a balloon ride. Despite the pictures on the advertisement brochures they do not go into the mountains. They all go away from them. This is a bit of misleading advertisement. Beware, while it was a nice ride, I would not had played over $200 a person if I had known this.
reviews.title: Great place for the money

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed June 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I could have stayed in a very, very expensive hotel and not had a nicer room - top cleanliness. excellent bed, beautiful soft goods and hard goods, frig, microwave, pool, free wi fi, I loved this place!!! What an incredible value....
reviews.title: Wow - nice surprise!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I only spent one night at the Sedona Days Inn but thought I should write a little something about it. My husband and I arrived late at night with all intentions of leaving immediately for Utah in the morning, but ended up staying. We found the hotel easily after a long ride up from Phoenix. Linda was working the front desk and was so personable and delightful that we let her talk us into all these hikes for the next day. Hotel room was OK, old springy mattress but still comfortable and nice shower. There was a little coffee pot and fridge in the room as well. Breakfast in the AM was OK. I went down right after it began and there were about 20 people already there. There are only 4 small tables though, so I had no place to sit and ended up taking my breakfast back to the room. Overall it was a nicely kept property, easily accessed and great staff. The internet was easy to get onto from their wireless and in addition they had two computers in the lobby.
reviews.title: Nice spot right off the highway

likes.liked: — Front desk reccomendations... hikes, food etc.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This hotel was a real find for us. We looked at alot of different places before booking it with them but were glad we chose the Day's Inn. We chose this hotel from reading reviews on trip advisor. It was very clean, the staff was very pleasant and offered to help us if needed. It was away from the high traffic of Uptown which was nice and still very convienent to everything we needed to be close too. It was a welcoming sight for us on this trip after suffering through two other very unpleasant hotels.
reviews.title: GEM

likes.disliked: — not really anything, it was a pleasant stay

reviews.text: After reading the other reviews, I decided to make this our hotel for a recent 3-night trip to Sedona. Unfortunately, we did not have a great experience. Our room was in the older part of the hotel. We had a king suite on the 1st floor, facing the traffic.
reviews.title: Stay someplace else
Nice budget motel, friendly staff
reviews.text: The door didn't close tightly - we could see daylight underneath the bottom of the door and around the sides and top - not very reassuring in the land of spiders & scorpions. We killed at least 4 spiders in the 3 nights we stayed there.

The bathroom may have been remodeled, but it was still old. The showerhead was about 5 ft above the tub, comfortable only for short people. The water pressure regulator either didn't work, or there was none. When the shower on, there was a loud screeching noise the whole time the water was running. I'm sure some of our neighbors weren't happy we were early risers. Also, I was in the shower when another guest turned on their shower. First there was no hot water, then I was nearly scalded.
reviews.title: We loved the Days Inn

reviews.text: Stayed here for 1 night in May. We had rooms on the 2nd floor above the office and the rooms were either new or newly remodeled. Rooms were clean and nice and the price was very reasonable for Sedona. Continental breakfast selection was limited but adequate. Location was also good and the grounds and view pleasant. Would stay here again.
reviews.title: Good value at Days Inn Sedona

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Most Trip Advisor reviewers were either quite satisfied or were somewhat less so finding the lodging adequate. My vote would go to the adequate side. The room, bed and price were all fine, and we did enjoy our stay there. But if you have any nutritional standards or deviate from the mainstream in your dietary habits, the breakfast will disappoint.
reviews.title: Adequate place to stay in Sedona

reviews.text: Very clean well kept hotel with excellent staff. I would recommend this hotel to all.
reviews.title: Great Stay

likes.liked: — How clean and well kept the hotel was

reviews.title: Great place!
reviews.text: My friend and I needed a low cost motel for 1 night on the way to Williams, AZ. This motel was $100 with a large, clean room with a nice balcony viewing the red rocks. The only drawback was a tiny bathroom but it did have the sink outside. The included breakfast had a nice selection of choices. Staff were friendly and it was a really good experience. Relics Restaurant (5-8 minute walk away) for dinner was very good and unexpected.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My husband and I went to Sedona primarily to go hiking so we were looking to stay at a place that was clean, quiet, and priced right. The Days Inn met our expectations. The staff was very friendly, the grounds were immaculate, and the room we stayed in sufficed. It's on the West side of Sedona, a few miles away from Downtown Sedona but still fairly close to plenty of places to eat and shop. It is a "no-frills" type of place but again, if you're just looking for a place to sleep and shower for a decent price, this is a good place to look into.
reviews.title: Good Place, Right Price, No Frills

reviews.text: I just returned from a 10 day stay at this Days Inn, and was very pleased with our stay. The hotel is located in West Sedona, about a 15 minute drive from the downtown, and we liked being able to get out of the crowds and expensive, overpriced restaurants.
reviews.title: Good Hotel For The Money and Well Located

likes.liked: — Location, Location, Location and the price

reviews.text: Our second floor room was cleaned daily and was spotless, and had great views of the red rocks across the street. Even though we had a "standard" room, it came with a very clean mini-refrigerator, microwave and coffeemaker. It was very hot while we were there, and the air-conditioning unit in the room worked perfectly - actually put on a sweatshirt a few times because my daughter loved the room very cold. The bathroom was also very clean, with plenty of towels, and we liked the idea that the sink area was outside the bathroom so two people could "multi-task".
reviews.title: A place to stay...

likes.liked: — Fridge and microwave are so convienent. Nice big clean rooms!
likes.disliked: — Ugly hotel in an ugly location.

reviews.text: The front desk staff was great, they were very helpful in suggesting restaurants that were off the beaten path, and did not hesitate to give their opinions if they thought the restaurant was a tourist trap. They also went out of their way to make telephone calls to find out what route the trolley would be running and when.
reviews.title: Clean, large room, great service....but not the best views

reviews.text: We loved the pool. Although it was small, it was cleaned every morning, and there was a high wall surrounding it, so you were very much shielded from street noise. There was wonderful soothing "new age/world" music that was piped into the pool area, which made it that much more relaxing. There was also a nice clean hottub/jacuzzi in a separate gated area next to the pool, which was also wonderful after the cool pool water. We also enjoyed the nice touch of getting separate towels from the front desk for use in the pool.
reviews.title: good value

reviews.text: The hotel offers free internet access, you could walk over to the main office anytime (except between midnight and 5:00 am) and use either of the two public computers. This was a nice touch and very handy.
reviews.title: Great day at Days Inn Sedona

description: Sedona's best lodging value, Days Inn Sedona strives to exceed your expectations in every way. Our beautifully landscaped property welcomes you and at 66 rooms we have that not too big, not too small, but just right feeling. Our immaculate rooms all include flat screen TVs, microwaves, mini fridges and single brew coffeemakers. Our newly upgraded Wi-Fi is complimentary of course as is the use of our lobby desktops. Boarding pass printing and fax transmissions for a nominal fee. Start your day with a complimentary USA Today along with our recently expanded complimentary Continental Breakfast. Plan activities and dining with the assistance of our helpful and knowledgeable Desk Staff. We are the only Days Inn actually located in Sedona and among the most affordable of lodging choices in town, but we don't let it go to our head. Every guest is our chance to do it a little better at Days Inn Sedona where you'll feel at home in the red rocks.
